subtitle: A souffle dish that is bound to impress. Make sure you take it to the table quickly before it sinks for maximum effect.

method.text: Brush the souffle dish lightly with oil. Shake the breadcrumbs around the side and base, to coat.
Separate the eggs. Put 2 yolks only into a small bowl and the 4 whites into a large bowl. Make sure you do not get any yolk in with the whites - if you do, then scoop it out with a spoon.

Put the low fat spread, flour and milk into a saucepan. Bring slowly to the boil, stirring all the time with a wooden spoon and cook for 2-3 min until it becomes thick and smooth. Simmer for a further 30 seconds. Then remove from heat. Mix in the cheese.
Mash the tuna well with a fork. Mix in with the 2 egg yolks and stir into the sauce. Season well.

Stand the bowl of egg whites on a damp dish cloth to stop it slipping. Add the lemon juice and whisk steadily until you have a firm, white, glossy foam that stands in soft peaks. You can tell when the foam is ready if you look for the wiggle! If the foam wiggles a bit on the whisk, it's ready. But don't over beat otherwise it will become dry.
Beat 15 ml of whites into the sauce, then scoop in the rest. Using a metal spoon, gently fold in the white foam in a figure of 8 direction. Do not over stir.
Spoon into the prepared dish and put the dish in the preheated oven using oven gloves. Cook for 20-25 min until high and golden. Don't peek for 20 min or it will sink. Serve immediately.

title: Tuna souffle
